Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common

Class ObjectMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.ObjectMethods
  • public class ObjectMethods
extends Object
    General methods applicable to objects of any type.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Method Detail

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty​(Object obj)
        Returns whether or not the provided object is empty. Returns true if the argument is:

        • null
        • an empty String
        • an empty Collection
        • an empty Map
        • a zero-length array
        • a zero-size Sizeable
        • an empty Emptyable

        Otherwise this method returns false.

        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be tested
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is empty

      • isNotEmpty

        public static boolean isNotEmpty​(Object obj)
        Returns the inverse of isEmpty.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be tested
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is non-empty

      • isDeepNotEmpty

        public static boolean isDeepNotEmpty​(Object obj)
        Returns whether or not the argument is recursively non-empty. Returns true in any of the following cases

        • obj is null
        • obj is a non-empty String
        • obj is a non-empty Collection with only isDeepNotEmpty elements
        • obj is a non-empty Map, with only isDeepNotEmpty values (map keys are not checked for empty-ness)
        • obj is a non-empty Object array with only isDeepNotEmpty elements
        • obj is a non-empty primitive array
        • obj is a non-empty Emptyable
        • obj is a non-zero-size Sizeable

        Otherwise this method returns false.

        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be tested
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is recursively non-empty

      • isDeepNotNull

        public static boolean isDeepNotNull​(Object obj)
        Returns whether or not the argument is recursively non-null. More specifically, this method returns true if:

        • obj is not null
        • obj is an empty array or a non-empty array with only non-null elements
        • obj is an empty Collection or a non-empty Collection with only non-null elements
        • obj is an empty Map non-empty Map with only non-null values (NB Map keys are not checked for empty-ness.)

        Otherwise this method returns false. Contrary to deepNotEmpty, this method returns true for empty arrays, collections and maps. It only checks that the values they do contain are non-null.

        Parameters:
        obj - The object to be tested
        Returns:
        Whether or not it is recursively non-null

      • e2n

        public static <T> T e2n​(T obj)
        (empty-to-null) Returns null if the argument is empty, else the argument itself.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the argument
        Parameters:
        obj - The argument
        Returns:
        The argument itself or null

      • e2nEquals

        public static boolean e2nEquals​(Object obj1,
                                Object obj2)
        Tests the provided arguments for equality using empty-equals-null semantics. This is equivalent to Objects.equals(e2n(obj1), e2n(obj2)), except that empty instance of one type (e.g. String) is not equal to an empty instance of another type (e.g. Set). So:

        1. null equals an empty String
        2. null equals an empty Collection
        3. null equals an empty Map
        4. null equals a zero-length array
        5. null equals an empty Emptyable
        6. null equals a zero-size Sizeable
        Parameters:
        obj1 - The 1st of the pair of objects to compare
        obj2 - The 2nd of the pair of objects to compare
        Returns:
        Whether or not the provided arguments are equal using empty-equals-null semantics

      • e2nDeepEquals

        public static boolean e2nDeepEquals​(Object obj1,
                                    Object obj2)
        Recursively tests the arguments for equality using empty-equals-null semantics. In other words, for arrays, collections and maps, elements c.q. values are also compared using e2nDeepEquals. Map keys are compared as usual.
        Parameters:
        obj1 - The 1st of the pair of objects to compare
        obj2 - The 2nd of the pair of objects to compare
        Returns:
        Whether or not the provided arguments are deeply equal using empty-equals-null semantics

      • e2nHashCode

        public static int e2nHashCode​(Object obj)
        Generates a hash code for the provided object using using empty-equals-null semantics. Consequently, null and empty objects all have the same hash code: 0 (zero). Therefore non-generic maps and sets relying on empty-equals-null semantics will likely have to fall back more often on e2nEquals or e2nDeepEquals.
        Parameters:
        obj - The object to generate a hash code for
        Returns:
        The hash code

      • e2nHash

        public static int e2nHash​(Object... objs)
        Generates a hash code for the provided arguments using using empty-equals-null semantics. See Object.hashCode().
        Parameters:
        objs - The objects to generate a hash code for
        Returns:
        The hash code

      • ifTrue

        public static <T> T ifTrue​(boolean condition,
                           T value,
                           UnaryOperator<T> then)
        Returns the result of the specified operation on value if the condition evaluates to true, else value itself. For example: 
         String s = ifTrue(ignoreCase, name, String::toLowerCase);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The input and return type
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition to evaluate
        value - The value value to return or to apply the transformation to
        then - The operation to apply if the condition evaluates to true
        Returns:
        value, possibly transformed by the unary operator

        Type Parameters:

        Type Parameters:
        T - The input and return type
        Parameters:

        illegalValue - The value it must not have
        Returns:
        value or null

        Type Parameters:

        U - The type of the second argument to the comparison function
        Parameters:
        comparison - A function that compares value and mustBe and returns a Boolean
        arg0 - The value to test
        arg1 - The value to compare it to
        Returns:
        value or null

      • nullUnless

        public static <T> T nullUnless​(T value,
                               T requiredValue)

        Type Parameters:
        T - The input and return type
        Parameters:
        value - The value to test
        requiredValue - The value it must have
        Returns:
        value or null

      • ifNotNull

        public static <T,​U> U ifNotNull​(T value,
                                      Function<T,​U> then)
        Returns the result of passing value to then if value is not null, else the value supplied by otherwise. For example: 
         String[] strs = ifNotNull("Hello World", s -> s.split(" "));
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the first argument
        U - The return type
        Parameters:
        value - The value to test
        then - The transformation to apply to the value if it is not null
        Returns:

      • ifNotNull

        public static <T,​U> U ifNotNull​(T value,
                                      Function<T,​U> then,
                                      Supplier<U> otherwise)
        Returns the result of passing value to then if value is not null, else the value supplied by otherwise. For example: 
         String[] strs = ifNotNull("Hello World", s -> s.split(" "), () -> new String[0]);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the first argument
        U - The return type
        Parameters:
        value - The value to test
        then - The transformation to apply to the value if it is not null
        otherwise - A supplier providing the default value
        Returns:

        Parameters:

        then - The action to execute if the condition to evaluates to true
        otherwise - The action to execute if the condition to evaluates to false

        Parameters:
